description:
compute driver: VMwareVCDriver
volume driver: VMwareVcVmdkDriver

When deleting an instance that has a volume attached, the instance is deleted in the vCenter inventory but remains in DELETING state in nova indefinitely. At this time, the volume is still reported as IN-USE and attached to the instance.

Steps to reproduce:
(using Horizon)
1. create an instance
2. create a volume
3. attach volume to instance
4. delete the instance

Expected:
1. Instance is deleted and does not show up in the list of instances
2. Volume is detached with status AVAILABLE

Actual result:
1. Instance is deleted but shows up in instance list with status DELETING
2. Volume still attached to instance and IN-USE
title: vsphere: Instance with volume attachment stuck with DELETING status

commit c9c6bf9cc21591fb69f2edff4a0bbec8c509e6bf
Author: Gary Kotton <email address hidden>
Date:   Tue Sep 10 05:44:07 2013 -0700

    VMware: bug fix for instance deletion with attached volume
    
    The creation of the connection information required by Cinder to
    delete the volume accessed a resource that did not exist (as it had
    been deleted). This would result in the instance being in a 'DELETING'
    state and the Cinder volume in 'in-use' state.
    
    Fixes bug 1223074
    
    Change-Id: I5283b1ddea76c0eaaf7315fc8cf8969c6cd6755f
